author: Jeremy
title: Re: Stephen Colbert – twitchy.com
text:
— Seth Mandel (@SethAMandel) February 7, 2017 
Would it kill liberals to actually bother to figure out what they’re talking about before they spout off? Evidently yes. 
As Twitchy told you, Betsy DeVos’ confirmation has celebrities in full-blown freakout mode . Fortunately, they’ve got someone like Stephen Colbert to articulate their outrage in a thoughtful, intelligent way: Elementary math under Betsy DevosQ: Ned and Sheryl each have 4 apples. Who has more apples?A: Whomever Mike Pence decides has more apples. 
— Stephen Colbert (@StephenAtHome) February 7, 2017 
What is so difficult about understanding how the Constitution works? Suppose if Chuck Schumer — an actual politician — can’t be bothered to understand it , it’s silly to expect Colbert to make an effort. But still. @StephenAtHome The tie-breaking vote is the Veeps. Not a new thing. @StephenAtHome @lorinda1434 What's 2017 – 1787? 
The number of years the Constitution has provided for the VP breaking ties in the Senate. 
— John Druva (@jdruva41) February 7, 2017 @StephenAtHome you missed elementary civics 
— Rob Solo (@robsolo) February 7, 2017 @StephenAtHome now maybe try elementary civics. 
— Lyndsey Fifield (@lyndseyfifield) February 7, 2017 @StephenAtHome Elementary civics under Betsy DevosQ: Does the Constitution care about your feelings?A: No, not even if celebrities tweet. 
— Blame Big Government (@BlameBigGovt) February 7, 2017 Trending
